Detailed Description

Class to contain, decompress and draw a PNG compatible image.

Member Enumeration Documentation

Constructor & Destructor Documentation

PngImage::PngImage (   ) 
 

If the default constructor is used, the parameters have to be provided by using method Init().

PngImage::PngImage (  BinData *  data,
BOOLEAN *  success = 0
) 
 

Parameters:
data Pointer to a binary data stream which contains the PNG data. After passing the binary data stream, the stream is obtained by the PNG image and hence automatically released in the destructor of the PNG image.
success Output-parameter, which indicates whether the initialization has been successful.

PngImage::~PngImage (   )  [virtual]
 

Releases the binary data stream m_data if it is still obtained and destructs the object.

BOOLEAN PngImage::DecodeNextScanline (  DeviceContext *  dc,
PngDecoder &  decoder,
XYDIM  x,
XYDIM  y,
XYDIM  scaled_width,
XYDIM  scaled_height
)  const [protected]
 

Decodes the next scanline. If not successfull the corrupt image sign is drawn.

BOOLEAN PngImage::Draw (  DeviceContext *  dc,
XYDIM  x,
XYDIM  y,
INT  frame_idx,
XYDIM  scaled_width = -1,
XYDIM  scaled_height = -1,
const Rect &  clip_rect = Rect()
)  const [virtual]
 

Drawing a PNG image with the base-implementation of Draw() doesn't work for all kinds of PNG images: Alpha channel images can't be drawn since drawing transparent pixels is only supported using a dedicated transparent color. In case of an alpha channel image, this transparency color is not available since transparency is coded into the alpha channel. Adam-7 interlaced images can't be drawn scanline by scanline since the pixels stored are not packed in scanlines. The Adam-7 interlaced scheme is also called sparkling method. To overcome these shortcuts the base class' Draw() method is overridden and implements the whole drawing itself.

Reimplemented from Image.

PaintDc &  pdc,
const Rect &  clip_rect,
XYDIM  y
)  const [protected]

PaintDc &  pdc,
const Rect &  clip_rect,
XYDIM  x,
XYDIM  y,
const Color &  color
)  const [inline, protected]
 

Draws the pixel at position (x, y) with the given color. The pixel is drawn in device context pdc and in the internal bitmap buffer if buffering is possible.

PaintDc &  pdc,
const Rect &  clip_rect,
XYDIM  x,

)  const [inline, protected]
 

Draws the the pixel at position (x, y) taking into account scaling.

void PngImage::DrawScanline (  PngDecoder &  decoder,
PaintDc &  pdc,
const Rect &  clip_rect,
XYDIM  y,
UINT  thickness = 1
)  const [protected, virtual]
 

Draws the scanline at row y using the colors currently residing in the scanline buffer of the decoder. The scanline is drawn in device context pdc and in the internal bitmap buffer if buffering is possible. The width in pixels of the scanline is defined by thickness. The method automatically scales the width if required.

Parameters:
thickness Specifies how thick in pixels the scanline should be drawn. Minimum is 1.

void PngImage::EndDrawing (  PngDecoder &  decoder  )  const [protected]
 

Deinitializes the drawing process.

void PngImage::FreeImage (   )  [protected]
 

Frees the obtained image.

const BinData * PngImage::GetBinData (   )  const [virtual]
 

Returns the binary data of the image. Per default 0 is returned.

Reimplemented from Image.

UINT32 PngImage::GetFrameDelay (  INT  frame_idx  )  const [virtual]
 

Returns the time in milliseconds the specified frame should be displayed. The value Image::c_unlimited means that it should be displayed _forever_.

Implements Image.

Implements Image.

ColorValue PngImage::GetTransparentColor (  void *  context  )  const [protected, virtual]
 

Returns the color-value of the transparent color. The value is only valid, if IsTransparent is TRUE. Per default 0 is returned.

Parameters:
context Pointer to the context-object, which can be retrieved within Image::BeginScanlineDrawing.

Reimplemented from Image.

BOOLEAN PngImage::HasAlphaChannel (  void *  context  )  const [protected, virtual]
 

Returns TRUE, if the image supports alpha blending. Per default, FALSE is returned.

Parameters:
context Pointer to the context-object, which can be retrieved within Image::BeginScanlineDrawing.

Reimplemented from Image.

BOOLEAN PngImage::IsTransparent (  void *  context  )  const [protected, virtual]
 

Returns TRUE, if the image has transparent pixels. Having transparent pixels may slow down the displaying-process of an image. Per default FALSE is returned.

Parameters:
context Pointer to the context-object, which can be retrieved in BeginScanlineDrawing.

Reimplemented from Image.
